revisions.rev:
{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2011}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | image = Kristen Stewart @ 2010 Academy Awards (cropped).jpg | imagesize = | caption = Stewart at the [[82nd Academy Awards]] | birth_name = Kristen Jaymes Stewart | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1990|4|9}} | birth_place = Los Angeles, California, U.S. | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 1999âpresent | website = [http://www.kristenstewart.com/ kristenstewart.com] | signature = Kristen Stewart signature.svg{{!}}90px }}
'''Kristen Jaymes Stewart''' (born April 9, 1990) is an [[American actress]]. She is best known for playing [[Bella Swan]] in ''[[The Twilight Saga (film series)|The Twilight Saga]]''. She has also starred in films including ''[[Panic Room]]'' (2002), ''[[Zathura (film)|Zathura]]'' (2005), ''[[In the Land of Women]]'' (2007), ''[[The Messengers (film)|The Messengers]]'' (2007), ''[[Adventureland (film)|Adventureland]]'' (2009) and ''[[The Runaways (film)|The Runaways]]'' (2010).
== Early life == Stewart was born and raised in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1807776250/bio |title=Kristen Stewart Biography â Yahoo! Movies |publisher=Movies.yahoo.com |date=April 9, 1990 |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref><ref>According to the State of California. ''California Birth Index, 1905â1995''. Center for Health Statistics, California Department of Health Services, Sacramento, California. At Ancestry.com</ref><ref name="australia">{{cite web|url=http://www.moviesonline.ca/movienews_11136.html |title=Kristen Stewart Interview, The Messengers |publisher=Moviesonline.ca |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref> Her father, John Stewart, is a stage manager and television producer who has worked for [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://www.askmen.com/women/celeb_profiles_actress_60/96_kristen_stewart.html |title=Kristen Stewart |publisher=AskMen.com<! |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref> Her mother, Jules Mann-Stewart, is a script supervisor originally from [[Maroochydore]], [[Queensland]], [[Australia]].<ref name="australia"/><ref name=K11>{{cite news | author=Larry Carroll | title=EXCLUSIVE: 'Twilight' Stars Kristen Stewart & Nikki Reed To Reunite, Play Men In Prison Film 'K-11' | url=http://moviesblog.mtv.com/2008/11/21/exclusive-twilight-stars-kristen-stewart-nikki-reed-to-reunite-play-men-in-prison-film-k-11/ | publisher=MTV | date=November 21, 2008 | accessdate=November 28, 2008}}</ref><ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0543032/ Jules Mann-Stewart]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/15/Kristen-Stewart.html |title=Kristen Stewart Biography (1990â) |publisher=Filmreference.com |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref> She has an older brother, Cameron Stewart, and an adoptive brother, Taylor.<ref name =elle>{{cite web | url= http://www.elle.com/Pop-Culture/Cover-Shoots/Kristen-Stewart | title= Kristen Stewart: ELLE's June cover girl on relationships, privacy, and her critics | last= Fortini | first= Amanda | date= May 5, 2010 | work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]] | accessdate=April 23, 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.portraitmagazine.net/archives/kristenstewart.html |title=Interview from |publisher=Portrait Magazine |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref> Stewart attended school until the seventh grade, and then continued her [[Distance education|education by correspondence]].<ref name="australia"/> She has since completed high school.<ref>{{cite web |author=Dennis Hopper |title=Kristen Stewart |url=http://www.interviewmagazine.com/film/kristen-stewart-1/4/ |publisher=[[Interview (magazine)|Interview]] |date=October 1, 2009 |accessdate=October 1, 2009}}</ref>
== Career == [[File:Kristen Stewart Comic-Con 2011.jpg | thumb | Kristen Stewart at the Comic-Con 2011.]]
Her whole family all worked behind the camera, and Stewart thought she would become a writer/director, but never considered being an actor. "I never wanted to be the center of attention â I wasn't that 'I want to be famous, I want to be an actor' kid. I never sought out acting, but I always practiced my autograph because I love pens. I'd write my name on everything."<ref name="Biography Today">{{cite book |title=Biography Today|year=2010|page=156|publisher=Omnigraphics|location=[[Detroit, Michigan]] |isbn=978-0-7808-1058-7}}</ref> Stewart's acting career began at the age of eight, after an agent saw her perform in her elementary school's Christmas play.<ref>{{cite web | title=Girls of Fall: Autumn's Crop of Enchanting Entertainers | url=http://www.wwd.com/lifestyle-news/girls-of-fall-autumns-crop-of-enchanting-entertainers-1803246#/article/lifestyle-news/girls-of-fall-autumns-crop-of-enchanting-entertainers-1803246?page=8 | publisher=[[Women's Wear Daily|WWD]] | date=September 29, 2008 | accessdate=November 4, 2008}}</ref> After a year of auditioning, Stewart's first role was a nonspeaking part in the film ''[[The Thirteenth Year]]''.<ref name=autogenerated1 /> Then, she had another part in the film ''[[The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas]]'' as the "ring toss girl".<ref name=autogenerated1 /> She subsequently appeared in the independent film ''[[The Safety of Objects]]'', in which she played the [[tomboy]] daughter of a troubled single mother ([[Patricia Clarkson]]). Stewart had a major role in the Hollywood film ''[[Panic Room]]'', playing the [[diabetic]] daughter of a divorced mother ([[Jodie Foster]]). The film received generally positive reviews, and Stewart garnered positive notices for her performance. She was nominated for a [[Young Artist Award]] for her performance.<ref name="Biography Today, pp.158">"Biography Today", pp.158</ref>
After ''Panic Room''{{'}}s success, Stewart was cast in another thriller, ''[[Cold Creek Manor]]'', playing the daughter of [[Dennis Quaid]]'s and [[Sharon Stone]]'s characters. She was again nominated for a [[Young Artist Award]] for her performance.<ref name="Biography Today, pp.158"/> It was revealed that at about this time in her career, she had to be [[homeschooling|homeschooled]] due to her irregular schedule, which was affecting her grades. She said, "I started homeschooling because my teachers were failing me. I think it was just resentment â I made more work for them. But homeschooling is great; you can study what you want, which allows you to get more excited about what you're doing".<ref name="Biography Today, pp.158"/>
Her first starring role followed, in the children's action-comedy ''[[Catch That Kid]]'', opposite [[Max Thieriot]] and [[Corbin Bleu]]. Stewart also played the role of Lila in the thriller ''[[Undertow (2004 film)|Undertow]]''. To date, Stewart's most critically acclaimed role may be in the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] television film ''[[Speak (film)|Speak]]'' (2004), based on [[Speak (novel)|the novel]] by [[Laurie Halse Anderson]]. Stewart, 13 at the time of filming, played high school freshman Melinda Sordino, who stops almost all verbal contact after being raped. Stewart received great praise for playing the character, who had only a few speaking lines, but kept up a darkly humorous commentary inside her head throughout the film. [[File:Kristen Stewart 2008, 2.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Kristen Stewart in October 2008.]]
In 2005, Stewart appeared in the fantasy-adventure film ''[[Zathura (film)|Zathura]]'', playing the role of Lisa, the irresponsible older sister of two little boys, who turn their house into a spacecraft hurtling uncontrollably in outer space by playing a board game. The film received praise by critics, but Stewart's performance did not garner much media attention, as it was noted that her character is immobilized during most of the film.<ref>[http://www.nytimes.com/2005/11/11/movies/11zath.html?_r=1&oref=slogin From Suburbia and Stranded Somewhere Near Saturn] from ''New York Times''</ref> The following year, she played the character Maya in ''[[Fierce People (film)|Fierce People]]'', directed by [[Griffin Dunne]]. After that film, she received the lead role of Jess Solomon in the [[supernatural]] thriller film ''[[The Messengers (film)|The Messengers]]''.
In 2007, Stewart appeared as teenager Lucy Hardwicke in ''[[In the Land of Women]]'', a romantic drama starring [[Meg Ryan]] and [[Adam Brody]]. The film, as well as Stewart's performance, received mixed reviews. That same year, Stewart appeared in [[Sean Penn]]'s critically acclaimed adaptation film ''[[Into the Wild (film)|Into the Wild]]''. For her portrayal of Tracy â a teenage singer who has a crush on young adventurer [[Christopher McCandless]] â Stewart received generally positive reviews. [[Salon.com]] considered her work a "sturdy, sensitive performance",<ref>[http://www.salon.com/ent/movies/review/2007/09/21/wild/ "Into the Wild"] from ''[[Salon.com]]''</ref> and the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' noted that she did "vividly well with a sketch of a role."<ref>[http://chicago.metromix.com/movies/movie_review/movie-review-into-the/209126/content Movie review: 'Into the Wild'] from [[Chicago Tribune]]</ref> Her performance was not without detractors, however; [[Variety (magazine)|''Variety'']]'s critic Dennis Harvey wrote, "It's unclear whether Stewart means to be playing [[hippie]]-chick Tracy as vapid, or whether it just comes off that way."<ref>[http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117934548.html?categoryid=31&cs=1&p=0 Into the Wild review] from ''[[Variety magazine]]''</ref> After ''Into the Wild'', Stewart had a cameo appearance in ''[[Jumper (film)|Jumper]]'' and also appeared in ''[[What Just Happened]]'', which was released in October 2008.<ref>[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/film/news/e3i28d20febe0f2d51b61c3cf616385dced 'What Just Happened' sets release]{{dead link|date=July 2011}} from ''[[Hollywood Reporter]]''</ref> She also co-stars in ''[[The Cake Eaters]]'' an independent film that has only been screened at film festivals.
On November 16, 2007, [[Summit Entertainment]] announced that Stewart would play [[Bella Swan|Isabella "Bella" Swan]] in the film ''[[Twilight (2008 film)|Twilight]]'', based on [[Stephenie Meyer]]'s bestselling [[vampire]] romance [[Twilight (novel)|novel of the same name]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stepheniemeyer.com/twilight_movie.html |title=Twilight Series | Twilight | Twilight the Movie |publisher=StephenieMeyer.com |accessdate=January 2, 2010}}</ref> Stewart was on the set of ''[[Adventureland (film)|Adventureland]]'' when director [[Catherine Hardwicke]] visited her for an informal screen test which "captivated" the director.<ref>{{cite news | author=Nicole Sperling | url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20211840,00.html | title='Twilight': Inside the First Stephenie Meyer Movie | date=July 10, 2008 | work=Entertainment Weekly | accessdate=July 26, 2008}}</ref> She stars alongside [[Robert Pattinson]], who plays [[Edward Cullen]], her character's vampire boyfriend. The film began production in February 2008 and finished filming in May 2008. ''Twilight'' was released domestically on November 21, 2008.<ref>[http://themovie-fanatic.com/the_buzz!/movie_news/twilight_new_date_of_release/ A Strategic Move? Twilight moves release date to November 21! â The Movie-Fanatic]{{Dead link|date=January 2010}}</ref> Her performance garnered mixed reviews with some critcs calling her "the ideal casting choice" and praising her for conveying "Bella's detachment, as well as her need to bust through it"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20241357,00.html|title=Twilight Review|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|date=November 25, 2008|accessdate=June 27, 2011}}</ref> while others criticized her acting for being "wooden" and lacking variety in her facial expressions which they described as "blank".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/reviews/2008-11-19-twilight_N.htm?csp=IMDBreviews|title='Twilight' barely gets the blood flowing|publisher=[[USA Today]]|date=November 20, 2008|accessdate=June 27, 2011}}</ref> After the release of ''Twilight'', Kristen Stewart was awarded the MTV Movie Award for Best Female Performance for her portrayal as Bella Swan.
Stewart reappeared as Bella in the sequel, ''[[The Twilight Saga: New Moon]]'' to critical acclaim, receiving much more positive reviews than her portrayal of the same character in ''Twilight''. Jordan Mintzer from ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' called Stewart "the heart and soul of the film" and praised her for giving "both weight and depth to dialogue...that would sound like typical chick-lit blather in the mouth of a less engaging actress, and she makes Bella's psychological wounds seem like the real deal"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117941623?refcatid=31|title=Variey Reviews - New Moon - Film Reviews|author=Jordan Mintzer|publisher=Variety|date=November 18, 2009|accessdate=June 27, 2011}}</ref> while critics who gave the film its worst reviews still found her performance "bringing plenty of soul" to the character.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/review/a186951/the-twilight-saga-new-moon.html|title=The Twilight Saga; New Moon - Movies Reviews|author=Stella Papamichael|publisher=Digital Spy.com|date=November 17, 2009|accessdate=June 27, 2011}}</ref> She reprised this role in ''[[The Twilight Saga: Eclipse]]''.
Stewart has been nominated and presented with the [[Rising Star Award, BAFTA|BAFTA Rising Star award]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bafta.orange.co.uk/ |title=Orange British Academy Film Awards |publisher=Bafta.orange.co.uk |accessdate=April 26, 2010}}</ref> At the 2010 82nd Annual Academy Awards, Stewart and ''[[Twilight (2008 film)|Twilight]]'' co-star [[Taylor Lautner]] presented a tribute in honour of the horror movie genre.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.instyle.co.uk/award/page/23992/31718?destination=node/23992 |title=Kristen Stewart and Taylor Lautner team up at the Oscars | InStyle UK |publisher=Instyle.co.uk |date=March 8, 2010 |accessdate=April 26, 2010}}</ref>
[[File:Kristen Stewart Crillon Hotel.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Stewart in November 2009]] In 2009, Stewart starred in ''[[The Yellow Handkerchief (2010 film)|The Yellow Handkerchief]]'', which debuted at the Sundance Film Festival and was released into theaters in 2010 by [[Samuel Goldwyn Films]]. She also starred alongside [[James Gandolfini]] in ''[[Welcome to the Rileys]]'', which premiered at the [[Sundance Film Festival]] in January 2010.
Stewart most recently portrayed rock star [[Joan Jett]] in ''[[The Runaways (film)|The Runaways]]'', a [[biopic]] of [[The Runaways|the titular band]] from writer-director [[Floria Sigismondi]].<ref>{{cite news | author=Borys Kit | title=Kristen Stewart to play Joan Jett | url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/film/news/e3ia662814697fe5016d0a29dd4ac7d747c | publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] | date=December 3, 2008 | accessdate=December 3, 2008}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Stewart met with Jett over the 2008â2009 New Year to prepare for the role, and ended up prerecording songs in a studio for the film.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://suicidegirls.com/interviews/Kristen%20Stewart:%20Jett-ing%20Through%20A%20Twilight%20Adventureland/|title = Kristen Stewart: Jett-ing Through A Twilight Adventureland|publisher=[[SuicideGirls.com]]|date = April 1, 2009|accessdate =April 1, 2009}}</ref> She received nearly unanimous praise for her performance. Josh Tyler of ''[[Cinema Blend]]'' pronounced her to be "a modern day [[James Dean]]. She gives the kind of performance in ''The Runaways'' that hasnât been seen on screen since his death. ''The Runaways'' is her ''[[Rebel Without a Cause]]'' ... sheâs absolutely brilliant as Joan Jett."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/reviews/The-Runaways-4530.html |title=The Runaways â Review | |publisher=Cinema Blend |date=March 19, 2010 |accessdate=May 11, 2010}}</ref> The ''[[Metro Times]]'' wrote, "It turns out that Stewart is actually really good at capturing Jett's icy, tough-but-cool girl swagger, adding the needed touches of vulnerability that transform it into a pretty terrific performance... Stewart is a genuine rock star here."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metrotimes.com/screens/review.asp?rid=26192 |title=Kristen Stewart's Joan Jett is one of the many killer riffs that make The Runaways | |publisher=The Metro Times |date=April 7, 2010 |accessdate=May 11, 2010}}</ref> Also, [[A. O. Scott]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' noted "Ms. Stewart, watchful and unassuming, gives the movie its spine and soul."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://movies.nytimes.com/2010/03/19/movies/19runaways.html?ref=movies |title=Proving Their Mettle in the Men-Only Era of Rock | |work=The New York Times |date=March 19, 2010 |accessdate=May 11, 2010 | first=A. O. | last=Scott}}</ref>
She has been cast in the role of Mary Lou in an [[On the Road (film)|upcoming film adaptation]] of [[Jack Kerouac|Jack Kerouac's]] [[cult classic]] novel ''[[On the Road]]''. Shooting began in August 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://popwatch.ew.com/2010/05/06/kristen-stewart-on-the-road/ |title='Twilight' star Kristen Stewart to venture 'On the Road' | |work=Entertainment Weekly |date=May 6, 2010 |accessdate=May 11, 2010}}</ref>
Stewart was listed as the highest earning female actress in Hollywood in the "2010's Top Hollywood Top Earners List" compiled by ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]''. Throughout 2010, Stewart earned an estimated $28.5 million for all her movie appearances.<ref>Allen, Floyd. "[http://au.ibtimes.com/articles/108743/20110204/2010-top-hollywood-earners-kristen-stewart-highest-earning-female-actress.htm ''Twilight star, Kristen Stewart Hollywoodâs highest-earning female actress'']". ''[http://au.ibtimes.com/ International Business Times AU]''. Retrieved: February 4, 2011.</ref>
''[[The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn|The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn- Part 1]]'' was released on November 18, 2011. The film was successful in the box office making $283.5 million its opening weekend. Though the film received negative reviews, Stewart's perfomance was mostly praised. Gabriel Chong said that Stewart's performance, calling it "mesmerising" and saying that she "makes [Bella's] every emotion keenly felt that runs the gamut from joy, trepidation, anxiety, distress and above all quiet and resolute determination"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://moviexclusive.com/detail.php?c=55&desc=T&p=1105&t=t%20he-twilight-saga-breaking-dawn-part-1-2011_1105|title=THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN PART 1 (2011)|author=Gabriel Chong|publisher=''MovieExclusive.com''|accessdate=November 15, 2011}}</ref> and the ''Village Voice'''s Dan Konis saying Stewart "beautifully underplays"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2011-11-16/film/breaking-dawn-part-1/|title=Blood is Thicker Than Blood|author=Dan Kois|publisher=''villagevoice.com''|accessdate=November 27, 2011}}</ref> the role. However, some critics found that despite Pattinson and Stewart's chemistry, the relationship came off like a "charade"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.totalfilm.com/reviews/cinema/the-twilight-saga-breaking-dawn-part-1|title=The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1|author=Emma Dibdin|publisher=''totalfilm.com''|accessdate=November 27, 2011}}</ref> or that none of the three leads were convincing in their roles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/film/review-24011353-the-twilight-saga-breaking-dawn-part-1.do|title=The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn: Part 1 - review|author=David Sexton|publisher=''thisislondon.co.uk''|accessdate=November 27, 2011}}</ref>
In March 2011, it was confirmed that Stewart will playing the leading role in the film ''[[Snow White and the Huntsman]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Adler |first=Shawn |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1659300/kristen-stewart-confirmed-snow-white-huntsman.jhtml |title=Kristen Stewart Confirmed For 'Snow White And The Huntsman' |publisher=MTV |date=2011-03-05 |accessdate=2011-07-02}}</ref> Filming began on August 15 and is set to be released on June 12, 2012.<ref>http://www.hollywoodlife.com/2011/08/01/kristen-stewart-snow-white-robert-pattinson-2/</ref>
Stewart has also been attached to an upcoming big-budget, live-action adaptation of ''[[Akira (manga)|Akira]]'' from [[Warner Brothers]] for the role of Ky.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2011-11-29/live-action-akira-film-plot-listed-by-casting-call|title=Live-Action Akira Film's Plot Listed by Casting Call|date=29 November 2011|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=30 November 2011}}</ref>
== Personal life == Stewart currently lives in [[Woodland Hills, Los Angeles]]. She has expressed a desire to live and work in Australia, saying, "I want to go to [[University of Sydney|Sydney University]] in Australia. My mom's from there."<ref>{{cite web | author=Lynn B. | title=Kristen Stewart Gets The "Message" | url=http://www.agirlsworld.com/rachel/hangin-with/kristenstewart.html | publisher=A Girl's World | accessdate=January 2, 2009}}</ref> Apart from acting, she is also interested in attending college in the near future, saying, "I want to go to college for literature. I want to be a writer. I mean, I love what I do, but it's not all I want to do â be a professional liar for the rest of my life."<ref>{{cite web | title=The Vanities Girls | url=http://www.vanityfair.com/fame/features/2007/05/vanities_portfolio200705?slide=24#globalNav |work=Vanity Fair | date=February 6, 2009 | accessdate=February 12, 2009}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', {{when | date = November 2011}} Stewart stated that she dated [[Michael Angarano]], her co-star from ''[[Speak (film)|Speak]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ahlborn |first=Kate |url=http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2008/11/twilights-kirsten-stewart.html |title=Q&A: Twilight's Kristen Stewart | VF Daily |publisher=Vanity Fair |accessdate=April 26, 2010}}</ref>
